Articles.Content:
[sTOCK ONLY]

[NO MODS/UNMODDED]

Take out your best Missiles, Cruise Missiles and try to destroy my bunker, you need to kill the Mk1 Lander Core Module inside not the Cupola Module on top. I'm testing my new Reactive Armor System. (Armor System produced and developed in conjunction with Kraken Technologies)

INSTRUCTIONS: Just lay it flat on the ground near the Launchpad using hyperedit, or i could provide the persisent file where its already deployed on the ground ready to be shot at. (The bunker bouncing off the ground and killing the module does not count as a kill, it must be a direct hit)

-POST PICS OR VIDEOS-

Craft File: Bunker http://www./download/qjudhiqtq7kl8hj/BUNKER.craft

Edited December 2, 2014 by Zamovinar

3 things-

One- this doesn't belong in the RB section

Two- Andrew/Zekes will remove this bunker np.

Three- STOP MAKING NEW THREADS FOR NEW POSTS.

Check my thread on how it works, I just started a Tech Firm. Kraken Technologies http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/101595-NEW-STARTUP-KRAKEN-TECHNOLOGIES-%28K-R-K-N-Tech%29

EDIT: Here's the missile I used.

Edited December 2, 2014 by Megalodon 720
Did it bounce off and killed the bunker or did it really kill the module with a direct hit? It seems like it bounced off. I'll try your rocket.
The missile clipped through the armour and destroyed the module, along with the cupola on top. It hit at a weird angle which is why none of the monoprop tanks are damaged.
I was looking for a one hit kill kind of devastation. How many times did you hit it? at what angle? The armor is good right? what do you think?

The missile came in almost vertically on the bunker but was oriented at a 45 (ish) degree angle.

The armour is good but is probably more useful on a space warship.

I tried out the bunker against my retired P-500 Bazalt. The warhead clipped through the armor and destroyed the interior systems, including the module.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

It's still good armor, but may escalate a vessel's part count.
What do you people mean by "clipping through the armor"? I'm completely confused.

KSP calculates physics each "physics frame" and if there is lag or the missile is moving fast, it could be completely outside the bunker one physics frame, then far enough inside the bunker next frame to destroy the interior. Basically, KSP checks for collision detection only on each frame, then if it is not, it moves it forwards by a distance = velocity * physics delta time and checks again. Well-designed warheads can clip through the armor even if the main body of the missile hits the outer armor and is destroyed.
sdj64. That Explains it very clearly, thanks! By the way would you like a partnership with Kraken Technologies? I've updated my Page check it out.
Sure, added you to the list of partners.
the Romfarer laser makes short work of those structural plates, for sure. I use it to clear space debris.
